snippet: Rabbi Gilles Bernheim, who acknowledged plagiarizing from other writers for a book on Jewish meditations, said that to resign “would be an act of vanity and desertion.”
abstract: Rabbi Gilles Bernheim, chief rabbi of France who is under pressure to resign after admitting he plagiarizing parts of book on Jewish meditations, acknowledges significant moral errors but says he will not resign; he also lied about his academic achievements.
lead_paragraph: Rabbi Gilles Bernheim, who acknowledged plagiarizing from other writers for a book on Jewish meditations, said that to resign “would be an act of vanity and desertion.”
